direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve removing elements from the collection, but 'removeIf' uses a predicate for conditional removal.
Both methods remove elements from the collection, but 'removeAll' removes based on a collection of elements, while 'removeIf' uses a predicate.
Both methods modify the collection by retaining or removing elements, but 'retainAll' retains elements based on a collection, while 'removeIf' uses a predicate.
Both methods involve modifying the collection, but 'clear' removes all elements, while 'removeIf' removes elements based on a predicate.
Both methods affect the indexing of the collection, with 'removeIf' potentially triggering a reindex if elements are removed.
